trans-unit.source: Manage: Load Balancer Distribution Mode (Source IP Affinity)
trans-unit.target: Manage: Load Balancer Distribution Mode (Source IP Affinity)

trans-unit.source: Management features for the Azure load balancer distribution mode
trans-unit.target: Management features for the Azure load balancer distribution mode

trans-unit.source: Source IP Affinity (also known as session affinity or client IP affinity), an Azure load balancer distribution mode, ties connections from a single client to a single Azure-hosted server, rather than distributing each client connection dynamically to different Azure-hosted servers (the default load balancer behavior).
trans-unit.target: Source IP Affinity (also known as session affinity or client IP affinity), an Azure load balancer distribution mode, ties connections from a single client to a single Azure-hosted server, rather than distributing each client connection dynamically to different Azure-hosted servers (the default load balancer behavior).

trans-unit.source: Using Source IP Affinity, the Azure load balancer can be configured to use a 2-tuple combination (Source IP, Destination IP) or a 3-tuple combination (Source IP, Destination IP, Protocol) to map traffic to the pool of available Azure-hosted servers.
trans-unit.target: Using Source IP Affinity, the Azure load balancer can be configured to use a 2-tuple combination (Source IP, Destination IP) or a 3-tuple combination (Source IP, Destination IP, Protocol) to map traffic to the pool of available Azure-hosted servers.

trans-unit.source: When using Source IP Affinity, connections initiated from the same client computer are handled by a single DIP endpoint (a single Azure-hosted server).
trans-unit.target: When using Source IP Affinity, connections initiated from the same client computer are handled by a single DIP endpoint (a single Azure-hosted server).

trans-unit.source: Source IP affinity solves a previous <linkText>incompatibility between the Azure Load Balancer and RD Gateway (DOC)</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Source IP affinity solves a previous <linkText>incompatibility between the Azure Load Balancer and RD Gateway (DOC)</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Source IP Affinity can be configured for:
trans-unit.target: Source IP Affinity can be configured for:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Virtual machine endpoints</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Virtual machine endpoints</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Load-balanced endpoint sets</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Load-balanced endpoint sets</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Web roles</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Web roles</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Worker roles</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Worker roles</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Remote Desktop Gateway cluster using a single cloud service
trans-unit.target: Remote Desktop Gateway cluster using a single cloud service

trans-unit.source: Media upload (i.e. UDP for data, TCP for control)
trans-unit.target: Media upload (i.e. UDP for data, TCP for control)

trans-unit.source: Client initiates a TCP session to the Azure-hosted load-balanced public IP address
trans-unit.target: Client initiates a TCP session to the Azure-hosted load-balanced public IP address

trans-unit.source: Client request is directed to a DIP by the load balancer; this channel remains active to monitor connection health
trans-unit.target: Client request is directed to a DIP by the load balancer; this channel remains active to monitor connection health

trans-unit.source: Client initiates a UDP session to the same Azure-hosted load-balanced public IP address
trans-unit.target: Client initiates a UDP session to the same Azure-hosted load-balanced public IP address

trans-unit.source: The Azure load balancer directs the request to the same DIP endpoint as the TCP connection
trans-unit.target: The Azure load balancer directs the request to the same DIP endpoint as the TCP connection

trans-unit.source: Client uploads media with higher UDP throughput while maintaining the control channel over TCP for reliability
trans-unit.target: Client uploads media with higher UDP throughput while maintaining the control channel over TCP for reliability

trans-unit.source: If the load-balanced set changes (i.e. adding or removing a virtual machine), client channel distribution is recomputed; new connections from existing clients may be handled by a different server than was used originally
trans-unit.target: If the load-balanced set changes (i.e. adding or removing a virtual machine), client channel distribution is recomputed; new connections from existing clients may be handled by a different server than was used originally

trans-unit.source: Using Source IP Affinity may result in an unequal distribution of traffic across Azure-hosted servers
trans-unit.target: Using Source IP Affinity may result in an unequal distribution of traffic across Azure-hosted servers

trans-unit.source: Clients that route their traffic through a proxy may be seen as a single client by the Azure load balancer
trans-unit.target: Clients that route their traffic through a proxy may be seen as a single client by the Azure load balancer

trans-unit.source: Please download <linkText>the latest Azure PowerShell release</linkText><title></title> for best results.
trans-unit.target: Please download <linkText>the latest Azure PowerShell release</linkText><title></title> for best results.

trans-unit.source: LoadBalancerDistribution can be set to sourceIP for 2-tuple (source IP, Destination IP) load balancing, sourceIPProtocol for 3-tuple (source IP, Destination IP, protocol) load balancing, or none if you want the default behavior (5-tuple load balancing).
trans-unit.target: LoadBalancerDistribution can be set to sourceIP for 2-tuple (source IP, Destination IP) load balancing, sourceIPProtocol for 3-tuple (source IP, Destination IP, protocol) load balancing, or none if you want the default behavior (5-tuple load balancing).

trans-unit.source: If the LoadBalancerDistribution element is not present then the Azure Load balancer uses the default 5-tuple algorithm
trans-unit.target: If the LoadBalancerDistribution element is not present then the Azure Load balancer uses the default 5-tuple algorithm

trans-unit.source: If endpoints are part of a load balanced endpoint set, the distribution mode must be set on the load balanced endpoint set.
trans-unit.target: If endpoints are part of a load balanced endpoint set, the distribution mode must be set on the load balanced endpoint set.

trans-unit.source: You can leverage the Azure SDK for .NET to update your Cloud Service
trans-unit.target: You can leverage the Azure SDK for .NET to update your Cloud Service

trans-unit.source: Endpoint settings for Cloud Services are made in the .csdef.
trans-unit.target: Endpoint settings for Cloud Services are made in the .csdef.

trans-unit.source: In order to update the load balancer distribution mode for a Cloud Services deployment, a deployment upgrade is required.
trans-unit.target: In order to update the load balancer distribution mode for a Cloud Services deployment, a deployment upgrade is required.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example of .csdef changes for endpoint settings:
trans-unit.target: Here is an example of .csdef changes for endpoint settings:

trans-unit.source: Developers can configure the load balancer distribution using the service management API.
trans-unit.target: Developers can configure the load balancer distribution using the service management API.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to add the x-ms-version header is set to version 2014-09-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to add the x-ms-version header is set to version 2014-09-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: The value of LoadBalancerDistribution can be sourceIP for 2-tuple affinity, sourceIPProtocol for 3-tuple affinity or none (for no affinity.
trans-unit.target: The value of LoadBalancerDistribution can be sourceIP for 2-tuple affinity, sourceIPProtocol for 3-tuple affinity or none (for no affinity.

trans-unit.source: i.e. 5-tuple)
trans-unit.target: i.e. 5-tuple)
